flowchart
Class PrimitiveStatement

java.lang.Object
  flowchart.PrimitiveStatement
All Implemented Interfaces:
AbstractStatement
public class PrimitiveStatement
extends java.lang.Object
implements AbstractStatement

This is an abstraction of a sequence of primitive statements (e.g. assignments and I/O statements). A sequence of primitive statements is also called a basic block. A basic block is shown as a labeled rectangle (processing box) in a flowchart.

Version:
1.00 (Last update: June 8, 2008)
Author:
Dr. Wen-jun LI, Da LUO

Field Summary

          The text of primitive statements in the processing box.

Method Detail

paint

public java.util.List paint(int startX,
                            int startY)
Create a list of JGraph cells to represent this basic block.

Specified by:
paint in interface AbstractStatement
Parameters:
startX - The x-coordinate of the top left corner of the flowchart.
startY - The y-coordinate of the top left corner of the flowchart.
Returns:
The list of cells as shown in a flowchart. The type of the elements in the list is DefaultGraphCell.
